0600C9EE98454BFDA82F829CD2AA3534.description: Experience various dances that emerged from the United States of America.

5CEE65827715477FBCDE07C93564DA90.description: Observe different types of ballet as an inspiration for talking about and creating dance

C2AD8910951B4EFE98C1C27164D3334C.description: Use dance vocabulary when responding to or sharing opinions about dance

12AE448FBA12415980EE42EB40D8BCDA.description: Investigate how popular culture from the past and present may influence appreciation of dance.

AD0E6368063A418DB7D7D85F259B1DA1.description: Dance traditions existed prior to the colonization of the United States of America, and evolved as more people came to the land.

714B970E8DF14B84BC5B7CD853F0BE94.description: The way in which dance is understood and appreciated today has changed throughout history

60CBB601BF044BF0B120412026E41073.description: Appreciation of movement and dance can change through active reflection and experience with dance

6B3203677B8C42478880C2E30C1E9482.description: The Lindy Hop became a dance culture enjoyed by many races of people and that influenced the creation of other popular dance forms, including the jive, jitterbug, and boogie woogie

002C9A5CF6B04442815FD624C4B55D8A.description: The fusion of African and European dance traditions formed dances, such as the Lindy Hop, in which dance partners separated to improvise movements in an individualized manner.

689B9E556E2A49F9ADC1C5DFE58147A7.description: During the Harlem Renaissance, social dancing became a way for the Black community to come together and celebrate being with one another.

DB51C107D1DE4F46928BB0D15A3B8D7F.description: As the United States of America became colonized, people brought with them a large and varied tradition of dance, which became known as folk dance

3F010DDAEB0849A9B31DC1F46C1DC134.description: Before the colonization of the United States of America, the Indigenous people had rich and historical traditions of dance that continue to be celebrated today

76CE0514462E4DD8A1275D26D44EEEA3.description: Dance during the French Revolution expressed narratives related to equality, freedom, and brotherhood.

5DB5E7A1C8914A1F973F6AA71D8F66DA.description: Ballet d'action was a popular form of dance during the French Revolution and was characterized by movements that conveyed character and emotion.

606864A517604D35BA299EF93BFA0829.description: Ballet evolved from a social dance of the French royal courts, characterized by graceful arm and upper body movements, to being a timeless art form performed on a stage

3406F264BA7140609B2A028314637CD1.description: Marie Salle was the first notable female ballet dancer to wear ballet slippers and a shortened skirt in order to perform more-complex ballet moves

0D83A80881CF49498BB7991F518B866B.description: During the Enlightenment, ballet used narrative and music to communicate stories

425F5C9E63C344ACA42DEE161838028F.description: The Enlightenment saw the emergence of ballet as a valued art form, separate from opera and theatre

39E8D682AE5F41F6902A28DDB5278DDB.description: Stylistic features and functions of dance from ancient societies influenced the evolution and creation of dance forms during the Enlightenment

FFB73BB2F898477F92093D5EA9761473.description: Artistic traditions have changed over time to reflect popular (pop) culture as a form of expression from the people for the people

6EF861532A074741AE986F1A8338D4CC.description: Appreciation of dance can change with experience and inform future decisions regarding participation as a dancer and as an audience member

1FAC89C52F5842C59305C921A233B1B4.description: Responses to and appreciation for dance can reflect personal preferences and perspectives

316F5B224C1444DF8A9E9A277C25C578.description: Appreciation can shape individual artistry, curiosity, and engagement in dance.

1CBA02DFDD914BC0A366CE6E3D519B19.description: How did societal change influence dance during the Enlightenment, French Revolution, and throughout the history of the United States of America?

CC4FFCE25F9C4AFCB6CA770B661DC9E8.description: Appreciation: Recognizing beauty, goodness, and truth in dance can be developed by understanding the complexity and richness of great works of dance, the artists who create and perform them, and the historical and cultural contexts from which they originate

8322D5C11CB7424BBA5AC50D5B72C2CD.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of artistic choices when communicating intention in dance

2DDCDD2205444633BE496141CC96BDEA.description: Describe how feedback was incorporated to clarify or enhance artistic intention.

070EF32FC33C46A190AC6975E1FA3D02.description: Create movement and dance ideas with the intention to explore new skills or movements

EA1966FDA5144BF4B69D69F2AF0D783F.description: Create and present dance for enjoyment.

5EEA3AD7D69C40C98BB2EFAAFAC0A45A.description: Participate in regular warm-up and cool-down activities in dance

8DD5703983B14CEEA7CF4AB42C813931.description: Practise movement skills to strengthen artistic expression in dance.

3A381DB1630A471698B975F2A47D7414.description: Respond to a variety of stimuli in the creation and exploration of movement and dance ideas

69FD717E99D540AABC7C9186E049C4A9.description: Explore various styles of movement and dance.

B2A7884819664BC492F689ECBD5607DB.description: Experiment with how the elements of dance can be used symbolically

DD5E25420DB644BA8669BC2461752538.description: Create and perform dances based on a variety of inspirations.

6C4EF0D539F645C69A2B545389B6C1A0.description: Participate as a dancer and as an audience member in a variety of dance experiences

25287544951041AF8D551216DD6A987D.description: Rehearse movement ideas and dances prior to sharing with an audience.

10FCC84D3A6B425DB4D2A3EA8A09B6BE.description: Collaborate when on and off stage during rehearsals and performances.

87DC4A41FC11440992E9749C6D22D91C.description: Demonstrate how to follow cues when rehearsing and performing dance.

21184829801A4FA59FE78BA924C74CCB.description: Incorporate a clear beginning, middle, and end into dance ideas

C9B9CA2EDE574582A200E3000EAC4782.description: Choose how to structure a movement idea, phrase, or dance

5ACF868CC2804F5AA77BE7C5E679D9C2.description: A dancer's intention may emphasize process over product.

72F562F628F94F359545A39D9AE1E375.description: Intention can be linked to the purposeful creation, expression, or appreciation of dance

A53D00589D5547DFBE6702D3A09FE238.description: Intention refers to what a dancer means to express.

0DCE7EED449B4F8D8FB3EE8DD1FC57CB.description: Intention becomes evident to the dancer and audience when dances have structure and organization.

73E67956C0C942A3977A8D39B07AC60C.description: Artistic intention involves the process of decision making, problem solving, and reflection in the creation of dance

9E69CB2E016E408B9BD93D84971CF044.description: Learning a new dance skill or movement takes practice

1603BC69D5FF4C5399F5D54BFCEA9006.description: The creative process can be enhanced by taking creative risks, including working with various partners trying unfamiliar or new movements or skills implementing feedback working outside one's comfort zone

67890447520A43139415318516546436.description: A dancer's artistic intention can be enhanced or refined by viewing the dances of other dancers practising movement skills participating in dance activities and warm-ups that prepare the body for expression creative processes

7A4014F3FDCE47809ED3BDF9034ACFFB.description: Music, as a stimulus for dance, can be chosen to highlight movement possibilities.

0768360CD1B34AC59C80D9207DAC778F.description: A variety of stimuli can be used to focus intention

5BFB89561ECF483EB1D83F04F07929CA.description: Styles of dance can be appreciated for the intentional use of dance steps, sequences, or stylistic features

2FD4388DF1A04FB186E05274914BCB8E.description: Movement can intentionally and symbolically represent meaning through the use of space, including proximity, direction, levels, size, and pathways gestures and postures facial expressions force, weight, and flow creating shapes with the body stillness and balance

FAC4DB2B85D649EAA5F03166C113CE92.description: Movements executed with intention may be symbolic of mood, character, or theme

2EA493667E4440259AA766B076B8C8FF.description: Dance can intentionally communicate meaning in the way that movements are executed and organized.

22935F4541E24A8FAA916AD999703C1D.description: Intention can be communicated in dance through planned or improvised choreography

7B9098FF418F4FB7AFF81955E76D7F5B.description: Some dances are structured intentionally to highlight features of a dance or dancers, including solos, duets, or small and large ensembles.

B78C6EF1C7854235BB6E8E237E324704.description: Repetition, contrast, and emphasis can help structure movement ideas

A52F777043734D048900B394FFF5C3D3.description: Structure and organization in dance is achieved through choreographic forms a clear beginning, middle, and end collaboration cues from other dancers, music, or stimuli rehearsal and performance processes including use of onand off-stage areas

28DC5BB7ADB6465EB57C1A6279103D53.description: How can intention strengthen communication of movement ideas?

DD7046743A5448CF8D5CBA0ED9F6B192.description: Creating and presenting: Ideas can be represented through movement and dance that draw upon foundational knowledge.

39A457A5AF8046C8A9BFD5A8215E0454.description: Share and demonstrate new movement ideas discovered during improvisations with other dancers

DB7807C67D9E4CD78445B88AC3D91F04.description: Collaborate in the creation and refinement of movements and dance

1F62BD0C1DF140E791A3BC00EF8B0FD4.description: Discuss challenges related to improvising movements individually and in groups.

E76C7514CC6C4AA38B9FA9E9F05DA8AD.description: Apply problem-solving skills when moving individually and in groups.

55DFB67B357E4CFA9CBD7C997C4DDF2C.description: Structure and share improvisations within a variety of choreographic forms

0859C4FB4B5541BCAE4C1069ECB7EB46.description: Demonstrate an understanding of vocabulary related to the elements of dance and choreographic forms.

9AE3F7EBC6924B46B07CD707DD737693.description: Combine movement ideas using the elements of dance

65921AF412094586AF7E38C7AF04D3CD.description: Improvisation fosters social interaction and development of perspectives.

C76422C75CB9416384D3D46A1680C0FA.description: Improvisation is responding and adapting appropriately to the unknown, to the environment, and to unexpected situations.

0D10CC54F8564A93B52698C5C9F34DD4.description: Improvisation is a choreographic method used for creating, representing, and interpreting dance.

FB5228CB48D54E1EAF705484C82F6CDA.description: Improvisation can result in the discovery of new movement ideas

EBB1589F1AB542F7ADC5A454AF450C61.description: Improvisation includes opportunities to experiment and explore different techniques in a non-judgemental atmosphere

38C8CFE4EF2C4122BA2C57760E444C8A.description: Contact improvisation requires collaboration and physical contact between dancers

A2CE862EC5754F4C815DAF294347F328.description: Contact improvisation occurs when one dancer explores the elements of dance with another dancer.

3DE5D01076F54907BAF1AA5F9DAD1082.description: Improvisation can happen individually, with partners, or in groups.

4E1B27DB44CD44719165B34ABCFB2730.description: Thinking ahead while improvising movements can contribute to wellsequenced movements

E9CBC051A4654B2C939917F64479FBE0.description: Problem-solving skills can be applied in the moment to avoid errors in dance formations, timing, or execution of movements

2DA79FDFE71D4CDA8692F4CD09ADA3C0.description: Improvisation in dance is spontaneous and requires thinking quickly in the moment

757807CA82594B4EB7ACE660B63D09B4.description: Improvisations may not be interpreted in the way the dancer intended

85E8D32601274937B6A39D31B5F70277.description: Improvisation does not require a dance idea to be performed the same way multiple times

0FC772C1A8CD4999B69DCFE549E7C2AA.description: Parts or whole sections of dance can be improvised using choreographic forms, including ABACA (recurring theme) broken form that combines unrelated ideas chance dance, where movements are creating by responding to a stimuli like the roll of a die or an image

4AD152DC76CF480CBEB3A46B79B9D7C0.description: Improvisation draws upon the use of the elements of dance and variations in body, space, time, and force.

77644A56428B4BBCB1B06FD1E59ECCA8.description: How can improvisation broaden dance experiences and knowledge?

2B9A966DB482413CBC0C782C15955422.description: Foundational Elements and Principles: Dance literacy is developed through knowledge and application of foundational elements and principles
